title: Sansa’s Silk Dress Occurs Later
body:
his is what Sansa is wearing when she greets Daenerys the first time:

However, her silk dress must occur at a later date:

This look likely happy in episode 2 or 3. We have seen no screenshots of Sansa in her battle dress, so either it happens in episode 3 or after whatever happens in Winterfell.

See? The furs and dresses are different in all three images.

It seems unlikely that Sansa would have three different costumes in three episodes unless there was a significant passage of time. Arya’s costume does not change in the trailer or from the later promotional image.

To me that confirms Sansa’s survival past the Battle of Winterfell, but it also suggests a few interesting aspects of her wardrobe choices.

The First Costume

This costume is from the last season, and is likely to help show that not too much time has passed between seasons. This is important because a huge event happened in the fall of the Wall. We also see her wearing this costume when she sees the dragons.

The Second Costume

Sansa has a completely new outfit, not just a silk scarf. For whatever reason, we aren’t shown what this is, only a close up on her face that could be easily misconstrued as the same costume from episode one. However, that’s clearly not the case.

She has a softer look - darker furs, but also softer, and I am willing to bet the silk is to make her look like less of a threat.

We know that weird scarf things are a Northern and Westerosi tradition, but Sansa may be trying to look favorable to Daenerys and implementing an aspect of her guest’s wardrobe to placate her.

It makes sense. Sansa chose a very soft look when she went to convince the lords of the North to fight for her, but changed to a much more intimidating gown when Winterfell was in Stark hands.

The Starks are no longer independent rulers, and Sansa probably (wisely) realizes to look like a warrior queen in front of a warrior queen dressed to intimidate isn’t going to go over well.

The Third Costume

Notice that this costume lacks something important: furs. Sansa dresses in furs when she is in the North and nothing about this outfit is soft and warm.

If you pay attention to Sansa’s costume evolution, she always had soft looks until she was on Littlefinger’s side after Lysa’s murder. But then she toned that down when she arrived at Winterfell under Bolton control.

Sansa uses her costumes to signal how she wants to be seen. She’s also clearly not in the North… otherwise she’d probably have furs.

So this costume is interesting because now Sansa wants to be seen as powerful and she feels capable that she can do so safely. Just because she is leading an army doesn’t mean she wears armor. She has to feel like she has true control over that army, and that it has a chance of winning - something Sansa did not feel at the Battle of the Bastards That must mean she has access to an army or something that helps her feel and be powerful in the second half of season 8.

That is quite the contrast from her position at the beginning of the season, and it seems unlikely she would be able to wear or prepare this dress if she is marching with Daenerys’s army.

That means she likely isn’t.

Two Explanations for Her Scaled Armor

Her newest dress is interesting in that Sophie Turner calls it battle armor and calls her the “warrior of Winterfell.”

There are two major camps in explaining where she draws her inspiration from: the Tullys and the Targaryens.

Her Tully relatives have very big, flakey scales, but her scales are close together. I’m not saying Sansa couldn’t have changed it, but I think it’s possible given the look below it’s ot related to fish.

For those who argued it being related to dragons, I think it helps to look at a dragon.

Like Sansa’s dress the scales are close together, rather than flaky.

But it doesn’t really make logical-costume sense for Sansa to dress like a warrior Targaryen queen if she is fighting alongside Daenerys. She is, after all, not a warrior queen in that scenario, but a warrior lady… and Sansa does not dress to intimidate when she is not in control.

So what reason would Sansa have to dress in dragon-themed armor?

Perhaps, after Jon’s parentage was revealed, Daenerys and Jon were set against each other. To survive, Jon will need to win the Iron Throne. That means Jon and Sansa are in control of a sizable military force and Sansa believes they can win. There is also no question of Sansa’s own control over the military. But why would she feel so certain?

I don’t think it’s crazy to think Jon and Sansa may have married for duty. Jon may have needed to marry Sansa in order to secure allies, and instead of dressing like a Stark, Sansa decided to dress like a Targaryen’s wife to remind their subjects he is the rightful heir to the Iron Throne.

It just seems like the sartorial move Sansa would do.

summary: A Song of Ice And Fire + Houses House Stark & Flowers Eddard- IRIS: respect, faith Catelyn- CARNATION: admiration, pride  Robb-...
caption:
A Song of Ice And Fire + Houses

House Stark & Flowers

Eddard- IRIS: respect, faith

Catelyn- CARNATION: admiration, pride

Robb- NARCISSUS: conquest, victory

Jon- DAHLIA- commitment, discovery

Sansa- FREESIA: innocence, sweetness

Arya- GLADIOLUS: strength, remembrance

Bran- ASTER: wisdom, devotion

Rickon- DELPHINIUM: boldness, youth

*inspiration: olympic coven + flowers

summary:
So I know we
weren’t able to get that much from the trailer but I wanted to point a few things
out. @winterfellchild​
brought...
caption:
So I know we weren’t able to get that much from the trailer but I wanted to point a few things out.

@winterfellchild​ brought this topic up the other day, so I wanted to talk about it a little bit more since I was wondering too on who this person could be. At first I thought this was Arya because I had seen her fighting with a stick and twirling it around. Then when I watched it over again I noticed it could be a bow, like a few others have spotted. 

Then by watching the whole trailer over again, this scene hit me. Davos is walking around right here with some men to the side. Idk if these guys are holding bows too or not, but one seemed like he was in a clearer pic.

Now this is total speculation beyond this point and obviously it doesn’t mean it’s going to happen, these are just my thoughts, so don’t mind me..

I’m going to start off with Sophie’s interview.

“It’s full of betrayals, full of war, full of danger.”

Also, I remember Nutter saying this….

“As far as season 8 compared to the Red Wedding, I just have to tell you –hang onto your seat cause it’s going to be special.”

So here we have talks of betrayals and something that’s going to hit these characters hard. Now let’s go back to Arya real fast. I want to talk about what she’s saying here in the beginning ..

“I know death.”

“He’s got many faces.”

“I look forward to seeing this one.”

Shows right after the GC..

You know, I made an audio about the trailer already and I really don’t know who’s chasing Arya, but I have never seen her this scared before. She’s totally panicking here, bleeding on her forehead and has blood on her chest. The closest I’ve seen her like this was with the Waif. Me and a couple of friends were talking about this and I had told a few of them idk if it’s a human, but that It could be the NK behind her because the way the head is shaped. But now watching everything over I realized what if this is the huge twist like the Red Wedding that goes down? These men could disguise themselves as whoever for the “cause,” to help. Or change into any clothing. Notice all the scenes while Arya is talking too, it shows shots of Winterfell outside, with Davos, everything seems pretty quiet there. Then Varys and others are hiding in the crypts and all of a sudden being scared of the noises they are hearing. Then a shot of the GC after Arya is done talking. I think the GC attacks out of nowhere and catches everyone off guard. Also note that when Arya Is fighting her enemy here, they are bleeding. 

So I’m not sure she’s fighting a WW here. I think the GC could sneak in while they notice half of D*ny’s and Jon’s forces are more outside of Winterfell. And the guy with the bow could be one of the guys from the GC. They made sure to zoom in on this guys hand for a reason. He also seems to not be moving much while everyone else is fighting for some reason, seems to be more calm, probably because the odds are better on his side? Maybe he’s looking at someone, or spotted someone he wanted to find?

 So I do think this can be one of the twists this season, and mirror a little bit of the Red Wedding, if this comes out of nowhere. Just imagine, thinking they are ok for now till the other men can’t defeat the others, and then they get attacked themselves with less help since everyone else is fighting the dead. It also shows Jon running up right after showing that persons hand with the bow.

Next scene I want to talk about is with Brans voice..

“Everything you did brought you where you are now, where you belong.” With a shot of KL and Cersei’s face. If Sansa is taken to KL, it would make sense on where Jon would have to be. Cersei’s face is obviously satisfied with whatever is happening here. 

Then we have a shot of Sansa with the dragons flying over her. 

Ok, so about Sansa, does anyone else feel like Sansa’s story really is on the down low right now? We get two shots of her outside of Winterfell. Besides letting us know there might be a love triangle, that’s all we really get. Everyone else is fighting and Sansa is nowhere to be found, not even in the crypts or even with Brienne. As we can see she’s not with either Stark girls, but outside of Winterfell here.

reblog.comment:
So I know we weren’t able to get that much from the trailer but I wanted to point a few things out.

@winterfellchild​ brought this topic up the other day, so I wanted to talk about it a little bit more since I was wondering too on who this person could be. At first I thought this was Arya because I had seen her fighting with a stick and twirling it around. Then when I watched it over again I noticed it could be a bow, like a few others have spotted. 

Then by watching the whole trailer over again, this scene hit me. Davos is walking around right here with some men to the side. Idk if these guys are holding bows too or not, but one seemed like he was in a clearer pic.

Now this is total speculation beyond this point and obviously it doesn’t mean it’s going to happen, these are just my thoughts, so don’t mind me..

I’m going to start off with Sophie’s interview.

“It’s full of betrayals, full of war, full of danger.”

Also, I remember Nutter saying this….

“As far as season 8 compared to the Red Wedding, I just have to tell you –hang onto your seat cause it’s going to be special.”

So here we have talks of betrayals and something that’s going to hit these characters hard. Now let’s go back to Arya real fast. I want to talk about what she’s saying here in the beginning ..

“I know death.”

“He’s got many faces.”

“I look forward to seeing this one.”

Shows right after the GC..

You know, I made an audio about the trailer already and I really don’t know who’s chasing Arya, but I have never seen her this scared before. She’s totally panicking here, bleeding on her forehead and has blood on her chest. The closest I’ve seen her like this was with the Waif. Me and a couple of friends were talking about this and I had told a few of them idk if it’s a human, but that It could be the NK behind her because the way the head is shaped. But now watching everything over I realized what if this is the huge twist like the Red Wedding that goes down? These men could disguise themselves as whoever for the “cause,” to help. Or change into any clothing. Notice all the scenes while Arya is talking too, it shows shots of Winterfell outside, with Davos, everything seems pretty quiet there. Then Varys and others are hiding in the crypts and all of a sudden being scared of the noises they are hearing. Then a shot of the GC after Arya is done talking. I think the GC attacks out of nowhere and catches everyone off guard. Also note that when Arya Is fighting her enemy here, they are bleeding. 

So I’m not sure she’s fighting a WW here. I think the GC could sneak in while they notice half of D*ny’s and Jon’s forces are more outside of Winterfell. And the guy with the bow could be one of the guys from the GC. They made sure to zoom in on this guys hand for a reason. He also seems to not be moving much while everyone else is fighting for some reason, seems to be more calm, probably because the odds are better on his side? Maybe he’s looking at someone, or spotted someone he wanted to find?

 So I do think this can be one of the twists this season, and mirror a little bit of the Red Wedding, if this comes out of nowhere. Just imagine, thinking they are ok for now till the other men can’t defeat the others, and then they get attacked themselves with less help since everyone else is fighting the dead. It also shows Jon running up right after showing that persons hand with the bow.

Next scene I want to talk about is with Brans voice..

“Everything you did brought you where you are now, where you belong.” With a shot of KL and Cersei’s face. If Sansa is taken to KL, it would make sense on where Jon would have to be. Cersei’s face is obviously satisfied with whatever is happening here. 

Then we have a shot of Sansa with the dragons flying over her. 

Ok, so about Sansa, does anyone else feel like Sansa’s story really is on the down low right now? We get two shots of her outside of Winterfell. Besides letting us know there might be a love triangle, that’s all we really get. Everyone else is fighting and Sansa is nowhere to be found, not even in the crypts or even with Brienne. As we can see she’s not with either Stark girls, but outside of Winterfell here.

blog.title: I'm just here to geek out—On Hiatus
blog.description: On indefinite hiatus. If you’re a new follower, you’re about to be disappointed, sorry!

tags: oops i posted about my real life
but really i pity people who arent into sci fi and fantasy
summary:
Me, in the dressing room:   I better touch up my rouge, otherwise I’m going to look like a white walker on stage
The Rest of the...
body:
Me, in the dressing room: I better touch up my rouge, otherwise I’m going to look like a white walker on stage

The Rest of the Women’s Dressing Room: *dead silence*

Me: seriously? No Game of Thrones fans here?

Room: *crickets*

Me: SMH 🤦‍♀️ For the love of god, guys…..

Earlier that day I met someone who didn’t know what the Millennium Falcon was and refused to watch Star Wars.

Seriously, what is the world coming to?

blog.name: fangirlofvariousthings
blog.title: Tarable Me
blog.description: I'm just a girl who really likes making people laugh.

summary: I recently started rewatching Game of Thrones...
body:
I recently started rewatching Game of Thrones…

… And now I suddenly can’t stop thinking of a Flashwave fic based off of the relationship between Daenerys and Khal Drogo. Like, Barry would be Dany (but without the dragons) and Mick would be Drogo. Barry would be sold to Mick and have to learn how to love him. I need this in my life. So much.
